Context:
The George Brown College Continuing Education offers a Service Robotics Program in partnership with GlobalDWS. The program provides an introduction to the service robotics industry, its applications, impact, market, and future trends. Students will learn about the technical aspects of service robot hardware and software, challenges, and considerations. Towards the end of the program, students will create an implementation plan for integrating service robotics into an organization or industry.

The co-founder and CTO of Global DWS, Rami Wehbe, was interviewed on the college's Work Shift Podcast: Episode 14, providing additional information about the service robotics industry. Employers in this field can be found in various industries such as finance, healthcare, hospitality, education, and transportation.

Upon completion of the program requirements, students can request a certificate of completion using the department contact information provided on the webpage. For corporate training in service robotics, organizations can contact the college to arrange customized training. The college is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples.

The information contained in this website is subject to change without notice, and it should not be considered as a representation, offer, or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
